Object.Field:
Author: Sunopsis Version: 4.0 Last update: DEC-2004
Description: - Loading Knowledge Module - Loads data from a file to a Microsoft SQL Server using bcp or BULK INSERT sql statement. - This KM generates a BCP format file before calling either bcp or BULK INSERT. If the file contains a dummy ending column, you can use the ADD_FILLER option to add the dummy column to the format file.
Restrictions: - Works only with delimited fields - All the columns of the source file must be mapped. - When possible avoid performing data transformations. - When using bcp (USE_BCP set to yes), the file must be accessible by the Agent. The bcp os utility has also to be installed on the Agent. (MSSQLServer Client tools) - When using Bulk Insert SQL statement (USE_BCP set to no), the file must be accessible from the SQL Server machine.
Call command to execute a shell
Enter the name of the command shell specific processor. Examples: - On Windows: DB2CMD /c /w OR cmd.exe /c - On Unix / Linux: sh -c OR db2cmd -c -w
Enter the name of the command shell specific processor. Examples: - On Windows: DB2CMD /c /w OR cmd.exe /c - On Unix / Linux: sh -c OR db2cmd -c -w
Set this option to NO if you wish to retain temporary objects (tables, files and scripts) after integration. Useful for debugging.
Directory where the BCP program is installed on the agent's machine.

Check this option to use the OS bcp utility instead of the BULK INSERT sql statement. As the bcp utility is a client tool, the file AND the bcp utility must be present on the same machine as the agent. If this option is set to No, the KM attempts to load the file using BULK INSERT. In this case the file must be accessible from the SQLServer
Format file version. Set to 8.0 for MSSQL 2000
Adds a filler to the FMT file
This option adds a filler to the format file. For example if the file ends with a separator
Default code page for the Bulk Insert

# # This step initializes the variables used in the next Jython steps # import java.util.Vector as JVector import java.lang.String from jarray import array import os
# # Target connection variables # server = "<%=snpRef.getInfo("DEST_DSERV_NAME")%>" username = "<%=snpRef.getInfo("DEST_USER_NAME")%>" passwd = "<%=snpRef.getInfo("DEST_PASS")%>" target = "<%=snpRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "A")%>"
# # Source connection variables # srcfieldsep = "<%=snpRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[SFILE_SEP_FIELD]", "", "")%>" srcrowsep = r'\r\n' srcfilename = "<%=snpRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[SCHEMA]/[RES_NAME]", "", "")%>%s".replace('$', '') srcfileformat = "<%=snpRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[FILE_FORMAT]", "", "")%>"
# # Temporary Files variables # filename = srcfilename % "" fmtfilename = srcfilename % ".fmt" logname = srcfilename % ".log"
# # Columns List # collist = [] <%=snpRef.getColList("", "collist.append('%d;%s;%d' % ([POS], '[CX_COL_NAME]', [BYTES]) )", "\n", "","")%>
finalcollist = []
# # BCP load Options # fmtversion = '<%=snpRef.getOption("FMT_VERSION")%>' collation = '<%=snpRef.getOption("COLLATION")%>' addfiller = <%=snpRef.getOption("ADD_FILLER")%> codepage = '<%=snpRef.getOption("CODEPAGE")%>' bcpdirectory = "<%=snpRef.getOption("BCP_DIRECTORY")%>"
cdcmd = "cd %s" % bcpdirectory bcpcmd = 'bcp %s in "%s" -f "%s" -C %s -S%s -U%s -P%s > "%s"' % (target, filename, fmtfilename, codepage, server, username, passwd, logname)
# #================================================================================================ #
#=========================== # genfmtfile() # Generates the FMT File #=========================== def genfmtfile(): # Check if the file is delimited otherwise raise an error if srcfileformat == 'F': raise 'LKM Error', 'This LKM works only with delimited files'
# Dynamically append the column list nbcols = len(collist) + addfiller
i = 0 colsep = srcfieldsep for coldef in collist: i += 1 colprop = coldef.split(';') colpos = colprop[0] colname = colprop[1] collen = colprop[2] if i == nbcols : colsep = srcrowsep fmtline = '%d\tSQLCHAR\t0\t%s\t"%s"\t%d\t%s\t%s' % (colpos, collen, colsep, i, colname, collation) finalcollist.append('%05d°%s' % (colpos, fmtline))
# Need a filler if i == nbcols - 1: fmtline = '%d\tSQLCHAR\t0\t0\t"%s"\t0\tFILLER\t%s' % (i+1, srcrowsep, collation) finalcollist.append('%05d°%s' % (i+1, fmtline))
finalcollist.sort()
# Dynamically generate the FMT File f = open(fmtfilename, 'w')
try: print >> f, fmtversion print >> f, "%d" % nbcols for s in finalcollist: print >> f, s.split('°')[1] finally: f.close()
#=========================== # bcpload() # executes the Microsoft SQLServer BCP utility #=========================== def bcpload(): if os.system(cdcmd) <> 0 : raise "BCP Directory Error", "See %s for details" % logname
if os.system(bcpcmd) <> 0 : raise "BCP Load Error", "See %s for details" % logname
#=========================== # removefiles() # remove the temporary files #=========================== def removefiles(): try: os.remove(fmtfilename) finally: pass
